## Introduction

In this notebook, I'll document all tasks and etivities related to R programming from module 12 intro

### Defining the function sayHello

Define the `sayHello` function in R. This function will simply return the name "Jannis".
```{r}
sayHello <- function(name) {
  greeting <- paste("Hello ", name, "!")
  return(greeting)
}

```

### Calling the Function sayHello

Now that the function is defined, call it once with my name "Jannis" to see the output.

```{r}
# Calling the sayHello function with my own name
sayHello("Jannis")
```

The function returned the name "Jannis" as expected.
